title: U.S. household expenditure on soaps and detergents 2007 to 2018
yAxis: Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Average annual expenditure in U.S. dollars, with a total of 12 data points. The chart has 5 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly negative which exists from 2012 to 2009.
On the contrary, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2018 to 2016.
Likewise, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2016 to 2014.
In a similar manner, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2014 to 2012.
But, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2009 to 2007.
gold: This statistic shows the average annual expenditure on soaps and detergents per consumer unit in the United States from 2007 to 2018 . In 2018 , the country 's average expenditure on soaps and detergents amounted to 92.05 U.S. dollars per consumer unit .
